intro: Barrosoa morichalana, commonly known as the Morichalana barrosoa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively understudied in botanical research.
